Comment: Yet another example of mixed messaging within a party that constantly outwardly projects unity, while accusing the other side of being mired in disarray.  NRCC first goes the cowardly route early in 2025, when Musk was rightfully viewed as radioactive. However, this year's GOP house congress does not know how to do politics unless it's trolling 24/7. So you end up with senators who had already scheduled town halls who can't afford to look weak, combined with matriculating house members who want to look tough and invite dissent.  We've see a number of GOP voting veterans show up, seeking clarity, only to be violently shut down. You have to wonder though if they won't just blindly keep voting "R"
